result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Hooper Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Full Huber; May leave Rock County for Employment;   Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 08-18-15 to Report by 10-16-15.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.
in lieu of $543 costs, CONSECUTIVE to 49 day sentence, Full Huber, may leave Rock County for Employment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant William R. Hooper in court with attorney Robert D. Junig.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to Count 1; Count 2 Dismissed and Read In; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 49 days RCJail, with FULL Huber, May leave Rock County for Employment; $543 costs--11 days RCJail in lieu of costs, Consecutive to 49 dyas in lieu of costs. 0 days credit.

Defendant William R. Hooper in court with attorney Robert D. Junig.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant Vacated; Bond Reinstated;  Calendar call scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return on warrant on July 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant on July 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Robert D. Junig in court.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant authorized to issue.
Calendar call on June 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William R. Hooper in court in custody with attorney Kelly James Mattingly.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere., May get personal belongings one time thru police escort or 3rd party.
